description.value:
Trigger A creature Strides beneath the portcullis while it is raised

Effect The portcullis slams down, driving its sharpened ends through a grate in the floor. Creatures directly beneath the portcullis take @Damage[(3d12+20)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save). The portcullis is made of adamantine and has Hardness 31 and 120 HP (BT 60). The trap then rolls initiative.

details.description: A portcullis drops from the ceiling, landing with a heavy thunk. Seconds later, a cloud of acid rises from a metal grate in the floor.
details.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:45] to prevent the portcullis from dropping, @Check[crafting|dc:48] (master) to create a compound to neutralize the cloud of acid, or @Check[thievery|dc:35] (expert) to jam the pressure plate
details.reset: Once triggered, the trap must be manually reset by raising the portcullis. Once all the vials are smashed, the trap can't use its routine again until the vials are replaced.
details.routine: (1 action) A cloud of acidic vapor rises from the grate beneath the portcullis in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5]. Any creature that enters the area or starts its turn inside the cloud takes @Damage[(3d12+20)[acid]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:40|basic] save). A creature that critically fails the save also takes @Damage[1d12[persistent,acid]] damage. Each time the hazard uses this routine beyond the first, increase the radius of the emanation by 5 feet.
